thread.title: Carmel installs traffic signal at roundabout
thread.title_full: Carmel installs traffic signal at roundabout

author: chris.sikich@indystar.com
title: Carmel installs traffic signal at roundabout
text:
Carmel installs traffic signal at roundabout Chris Sikich , chris.sikich@indystar.com Published 11:55 a.m. ET Feb. 22, 2017 | Updated 3 hours ago Carmel has installed a traffic meter at 136th Street and Keystone Avenue. (Photo: Provided by Carmel) 495 CONNECT 8 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Carmel has activated a traffic-metering signal at the roundabout-style interchange at 136th Street and Keystone Parkway. 
The roundabout becomes backed up in the morning and evening due to students going to and from nearby Carmel High School, according to a news release. Five thousand students attend classes there. 
The meter will turn red only during long backups to keep traffic flowing, according to the news release. Most of the time, the signal will be inactive and the roundabout will function normally. 
"Those who travel through this area on school days are aware of the backups that occur, especially on 136th Street and on the northbound ramp from Keystone Parkway,” said City Engineer Jeremy Kashman, in a prepared statement. “This metering system is the most efficient manner of relief for this congestion that is only occurring during peak times before and after school." 
The signal cost $88,000.
